snippet.title: Sky Shark (Taito, 1989) - NES Gameplay
snippet.description:
This port of Sky Shark for the NES is true to the spirit of the original quarter-eating arcade cabinet, and is arguably one of the most difficult shooters on the system. Piloting a bi-plane, the player must take out land based targets such as tanks and turrets and shoot enemy airplanes while avoiding enemy fire from all angles. Collecting special pickups to increases the plane's firepower. The tagline on this title reads "Nobody ever said it would be easy", serving as an appropriate disclaimer to the frustrations which reside within.  As the levels progress, the enemy's hail of bullets intensifies. Enemies are not shy of spawning behind you to take a cheap shot while you're trying to dodge other hazards.

Known on Famicom as: Hi Sho Zame 飛翔鮫


NESGUIDE ARCHIVE INFO

The original NES gameplay archive, est 2007 includes gameplay captures from all commercial releases from the US market with a few extras (like famicom releases) just for fun. As of Dec 2024, I've resumed efforts to update some of the older (some 360p) videos with higher-def captures. Text updates will be posted to BlueSky (which doesn't require an account to view). Please follow there (or just bookmark the url) if you're interested!

https://bsky.app/profile/nesguide.com
